intro: Aniseia aurea, commonly known as golden anise, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like carrots and parsley. Aniseia aurea typically grows in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential medicinal uses.
